questions.question: Which renowned UNESCO site, famous for its dramatic cliffs and historical significance during World War II, lies on the Atlantic coast of Northern France?
questions.context: This iconic island commune is not only a stunning example of medieval architecture but also served as a strategic fortification.

questions.question: What modern architectural marvel in Dubai, known for being the tallest building in the world, opened to the public in 2010?
questions.context: This skyscraper stands at a staggering height of 828 meters and housed the longest elevator ride in the world at its opening.

questions.question: Which famous museum in Amsterdam houses works by a renowned Dutch painter known for cutting off part of his ear?
questions.context: This museum holds the largest collection of artworks by Vincent van Gogh, offering a glimpse into his tumultuous life and brilliant artistry.

questions.question: What ancient ruin in Yucatan, Mexico, famous for its pyramid and a site of ritualistic human sacrifices, was a center of the Mayan civilization?
questions.context: This UNESCO World Heritage Site features the Temple of Kukulcan, known for its staircase that during the equinoxes, creates a shadow resembling a serpent.

questions.question: Which space exploration site in Kazakhstan launched the first human into space in 1961 aboard the Vostok 1?
questions.context: This historic site has been the launch hub for many significant space missions, earning a pivotal place in space history with Yuri Gagarin's flight.
